analyzed: romasaḥ nāma nāmena  sayambhū subbataḥ tadā
translated: “My name was Romasa,🔽and I was a self-made good person then.
I do not remember any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the lotus flower.
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Ekapundarika recited these verses.
